title: Shooting Professional Photography in Small Spaces
summary: In this episode of Learn Plus, photographer Lindsay Adler demonstrates how to capture high-quality portraits, high fashion, and editorial images within a small 11x14 foot studio space, offering tips on lighting modifiers and lens selection.

steps.action: Introduction to the topic of shooting in small studio spaces.
Reveal the dimensions of the shooting room (11 feet by 14 feet).
Showcase examples of different photography styles including portraits, high fashion, and editorial.
Discuss upcoming tips regarding lighting modifiers and lens choices for small spaces.

key_takeaways: Professional photography results are achievable in small spaces as limited as 11x14 feet.
A variety of styles, from high fashion to painterly portraits, can be executed in a small studio.
Choosing the right modifiers and lenses is critical for success in tight shooting environments.
